tool_description: Simple, fast and affordable file upload. Once the presigned URL is generated, the file upload can be securely initiated by the frontend application.
name: Simple-Upload
title: Simple-Upload

api_list.name: Retrieve my account settings
api_list.description:
Retrieve the account settings, including:
- **Allowed origins**: These are the websites that are allowed to download your files. If a value is specified, then the origin header must match of the configured allowed origins. If it does not match, then a 403 "Forbidden" status is returned.
api_list.code:
import requests

url = "https://simple-upload1.p.rapidapi.com/settings/"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "simple-upload1.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())
api_list.convert_code:
import requests

url = "https://simple-upload1.p.rapidapi.com/settings/"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "simple-upload1.p.rapidapi.com"

print(response.json())

api_list.name: Get storage quota
api_list.description:
Retrieve the consumed, acquired and available download credit since the creation of your Rapid API account. 
- 1 credit is consumed each  time a file is download/viewed by the end user.
- 1 credit is consumed each month for every 1MB of storage.
- Download credit is increased each month, by a certain amount based on the user's subscription.
api_list.code:
import requests

url = "https://simple-upload1.p.rapidapi.com/quotas/storage"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "simple-upload1.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())
